result.execSummary:
The defendant Shane A Dougherty was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders $300.00 to be deducted time served in jail.  Remainder of fine of $116.00 to be paid within 60 days or penalty of 1 day Huber for non-payment.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
domestic violence program

Defendant Shane A Dougherty in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1. Count #2 is dismissed and read in.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Wolff makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  
The Court Orders the Following to count #1:
FINE: $416.00.  Court orders $300.00 to be deducted for the 3 days spent in custody.  Defendant will owe a remaining balance of $116.00.  
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid within 60 days.  Failure to pay; the Court orders the defendant to serve 1 day in Huber
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.

Defendant Shane A Dougherty in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Wolff moves to set this case for trial.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for December 10, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 10-16-2015 11:00 am
